\sin(10^\circ+20^\circ)&=\sin 10^\circ\cos 20^\circ+\cos 10^\circ\sin 20^\circ\\
\Rightarrow\qquad\qquad\sin30^\circ&=\sin 10^\circ\cos 20^\circ+\cos 10^\circ\sin 20^\circ\\
\Rightarrow\qquad\qquad\frac{1}{2}&=\sin 10^\circ\cos 20^\circ+\cos 10^\circ\sin 20^\circ.
\end{align*}Therefore, the relationship between $\cos 10^\circ$ and $\sin 20^\circ$ using the angle addition formula for sine is $\cos 10^\circ\sin 20^\circ=\frac{1}{2}-\sin 10^\circ\cos 20^\circ$. The answer is: \frac{1}{2}-\sin 10^\circ\cos 20^\circ.
